title: Contributing to saros
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("NIFU-/saros", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Analysis: Sorting Features in saros Package
text: Currently Supported: - ✅ Positional: .top, .bottom, .upper, .lower, .mid_upper, .mid_lower - ✅ Column-based: .count, .proportion, .mean, .median, .sum_value - ✅ Category-based: Single category (e.g., “”) multiple categories - ✅ Alphabetical: .variable_label, .variable_name - ✅ Original order: .variable_position Potentially Missing: - ❓ .count_per_indep_group - partially implemented may need testing - ❓ Custom sorting columns data - ❓ Sorting statistical measures (variance, std dev, range, etc.) Proposed Solution: - Audit current test coverage identify options fully tested - Document options supported provide examples - Consider adding statistical measures ’s user demand Impact: Improves feature completeness, clarifies capabilities

what: Options Analysis: Key Improvement Area 1 — “Potentially Missing” (Open)
title: Analysis: Sorting Features in saros Package
text: Goal: Decide scope, API details, validation/ordering semantics missing sorting options implementation. Scope candidates (): - ) .count_per_indep_group (totals-based ordering independent categories) - B) Custom sorting columns data - C) Statistical measures (variance, std dev, range, IQR) General contract (new sort modes): - Inputs: dep (one categorical variables), optional indep (categorical), sort_dep_by, sort_indep_by, descend/descend_indep - Outputs: explicit order columns (.dep_order /.indep_order) computed single, stable pass using arrange_with_order(); special-case precedence ordered indep factors remains intact. - Error modes: clear cli errors requested column(s)/measure(s) available inapplicable provided data; NA handling must defined. - Success criteria: deterministic order documented tie-breaks; compatible showNA handling; alter existing public defaults. Cross-cutting behaviors preserve: - Ordered indep factors take precedence sort_indep_by documented (.factor_order path). - descend/descend_indep change order direction; change chosen metric. - NA handling: exclude NAs metric computations unless metric explicitly NA share; still show row/column per showNA setting. - Ties: break using (1) .variable_position deps, factor-level indep applicable, else lexical label, name — document order. — ) .count_per_indep_group (Open) Definition: indep category (row), compute total count across selected deps (across dataset dep length 1) order indep total. Design options: - A1. Use existing aggregate .count_total_indep present; otherwise compute per-indep group total within indep-ordering stage. - A2. Scope total: - A2a. Sum across dep variables included call (cat_table_html path): ensures row-stable ordering regardless dep section displayed. - A2b. Sum within dep independently: vary dep compatible unified row order; reject tables multiple deps. Recommendation: A1 + A2a. Ensure single per-indep total (row-wise) available wherever indep ordering executes. Name: .count_total_indep. available, compute add_indep_order prerequisites. Edge cases: - indep = NULL: mode ignored, error. - dep single dep: still compute totals across single dep’s rows; order well-defined. - NA relevant cells: treat NA zero totals; document. - Ties: break indep factor order, label, name. Tests add: - Single dep vs multiple deps produce indep order using .count_per_indep_group. - descend_indep reverses indep order based totals. - Ties across two indep categories fall back factor level order. — B) Custom sorting columns (Implement B1 now; keep room B2 later) Definition: Allow sort_dep_by/sort_indep_by reference arbitrary computed columns (present pre-render data). Design options: - B1. Whitelist: allow documented set safe columns (e.g., .count, .proportion, .sum_value, .mean, .median, .count_total_indep, etc.). - B2. Open reference: accept column name string; validate existence numeric/ordering compatibility. Recommendation: Implement B1 now (whitelist), schema differs path (table vs plot) arbitrary columns missing. Keep room support B2 later hood (UX exposure yet) validation schema guarantees stronger. Validation: - validate_sort_column(data, column_name) fail fast missing. - non-numeric columns, use lexical ordering warning unless explicitly allowed (e.g., .variable_label). Tests add: - Attempt sorting missing column -> cli error helpful message. - Sorting non-numeric column outside allowed set -> warning error per policy. — C) Statistical measures (variance, std dev, range) (Open) Definition: Compute variability metrics across categories across indep groups rank deps (typical use) indep (less typical). Design options: - C1. Per-dep variability across categories (e.g., range category proportions), order deps metric. - C2. Per-dep variability across indep groups target category combined categories. Recommendation: Start C1 require indep interpretable cat_table_html; explicitly define measure computed (range default; optionally std dev later). Details: - Specify categories included (non-NA) whether ’re weighted counts. Initial version: unweighted, proportions. - desc behavior: higher variability first descend = TRUE. Tests add: - Synthetic data known ranges verifies ordering. - Ties fall back label/name tie-breaks. Proposed acceptance criteria (phase 1): - Implement ) .count_per_indep_group indep ordering cat_table_html path using .count_total_indep documented tie-breaks; add tests; change public defaults. - Add validation helpers missing columns/categories wire fail fast B–D. - Document scope examples ) planned B–D vignette; postpone implementation B–D pending feedback. Open questions maintainers (carry GH Issues): - .count_total_indep materialized upstream (e.g., summarize_cat_cat_data) keep ordering helpers pure, computed demand inside add_indep_order? - C) D), foresee plot variants requiring metrics? yes, add shared metrics module avoid duplication? - Preferred default target category none specified D)? Next (planning ; code yet): - Decide A1/A2 materialization location finalize whitelist B1. - Draft test skeletons (skipped) lock expected behavior implementation. —

text: {saros} (Semi-Automatic Reporting Ordinary Surveys) R package designed handle repeating surveys within project occur annually biannually. aims automate process summarizing reporting survey data, helping researchers save time maintain consistency across survey iterations. what: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
title: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
text: Creates Quarto tabset named list ggplot2 objects, typically generated makeme() crowd parameter. plot becomes tab automatic height calculation optional download links.

title: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
code: crowd_plots_as_tabset(   plot_list,   plot_type = c("cat_plot_html", "int_plot_html", "auto"),   save = FALSE,   fig_height = NULL,   fig_height_int_default = 6 )

title: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
text: plot_list named list ggplot2 objects. Names become tab labels. Typically created makeme(crowd = c("target", "others")). plot_type Character. Type plots list. One : "cat_plot_html" (default): Categorical horizontal bar charts "int_plot_html": Interval plots (violin/box plots) "auto": Auto-detect first non-NULL plot's data structure save Logical. TRUE (default), generates download links plot data images via get_fig_title_suffix_from_ggplot(). fig_height Numeric NULL. Manual figure height override inches. NULL (default), height calculated automatically based plot_type. fig_height_int_default Numeric. Default height interval plots auto-calculation available (default: 6 inches).

title: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function's purpose side effect printing Quarto markdown creates tabset.

title: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
text: function designed called within Quarto document code chunk. generates markdown creates tabset non-NULL plot plot_list appears separate tab. Height Calculation: "cat_plot_html": Uses fig_height_h_barchart2() accounts number variables, categories, label lengths "int_plot_html": Uses fig_height_int_default (simpler plots need less sophisticated calculation) "auto": Detects type checking .category column (categorical) vs numeric statistics columns (interval) Requirements: Must run within knitr/Quarto context Plots created makeme() Plot list meaningful names tab labels

title: Convert List of Plots to Quarto Tabset — crowd_plots_as_tabset
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # In a Quarto document plots <- makeme(   data = ex_survey,   dep = b_1:b_3,   crowd = c("target", "others"),   mesos_var = "f_uni",   mesos_group = "Uni of A" )  # Create tabset with auto-detection crowd_plots_as_tabset(plots)  # Create tabset for interval plots int_plots <- makeme(   data = ex_survey,   dep = c_1:c_2,   indep = x1_sex,   type = "int_plot_html",   crowd = c("target", "others"),   mesos_var = "f_uni",   mesos_group = "Uni of A" ) crowd_plots_as_tabset(int_plots, plot_type = "int_plot_html")  # Without download links crowd_plots_as_tabset(plots, save = FALSE)  # With manual height override crowd_plots_as_tabset(plots, fig_height = 8) } # }

title: Estimate figure height for a horizontal bar chart — fig_height_h_barchart
text: n_y, n_x Integer. Number dependent/independent variables. n_cats_y Integer. Number categories across dependent variables. max_chars_labels_y Integer. Maximum number characters across dependent variables' labels. max_chars_cats_y Integer. Maximum number characters across dependent variables' response categories (levels). n_cats_x Integer NULL. Number categories across independent variables. max_chars_labels_x Integer NULL. Maximum number characters across independent variables' labels. max_chars_cats_x Integer NULL. Maximum number characters across independent variables' response categories (levels). freq Logical. TRUE, frequency plot categories next . FALSE (default), proportion plot stacked categories. x_axis_label_width, strip_width Numeric. Width allocated x-axis labels strip labels respectively. strip_angle Numeric. Angle strip text. main_font_size Numeric. Font size main text. legend_location Character. Location legend. "plot" (default) "panel". n_legend_lines Integer. Number lines legend. legend_key_chars_equivalence Integer. Approximate number characters legend key equals. multiplier_per_horizontal_line Numeric. Multiplier per horizontal line. multiplier_per_vertical_letter Numeric. Multiplier per vertical letter. multiplier_per_facet Numeric. Multiplier per facet height. multiplier_per_bar Numeric. Multiplier per bar height (thickness). multiplier_per_legend_line Numeric. Multiplier per legend line. multiplier_per_plot Numeric. Multiplier entire plot estimates. fixed_constant Numeric. Fixed constant added height. margin_in_cm Numeric. Margin centimeters. figure_width_in_cm Numeric. Width figure centimeters. max Numeric. Maximum height. min Numeric. Minimum height. hide_axis_text_if_single_variable Boolean. Whether label hidden single dependent variable plots. add_n_to_dep_label, add_n_to_indep_label Boolean. TRUE, add 10 characters max label lengths. primarily useful obtaining settings global environment, avoiding need compute figure chunk. showNA String, one "ifany", "always" "never". yet use.

title: Wrapper Function for ggplot2::ggsave() with Palette Support — ggsaver
code: library(ggplot2) my_plot <- ggplot(data=mtcars, aes(x=hp, y=mpg, fill=factor(cyl))) + geom_point()  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save with default settings ggsaver(my_plot, tempfile(fileext = ".png"))  # Set global palette and save global_settings_set(   fn_name = "girafe",   new = list(palette_codes = list(c("red", "blue", "green"))) ) ggsaver(my_plot, tempfile(fileext = ".png"))  # Override global palette for specific save ggsaver(   my_plot,   tempfile(fileext = ".png"),   palette_codes = list(c("purple", "orange", "yellow")) ) } # }

title: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
text: data data.frame/tibble srvyr-object (experimental) data.frame // required data used plotting. dep, indep Variable selections <tidyselect> // Default: NULL, meaning everything dep, nothing indep. Columns data. dep compulsory. type Kind output scalar<character> // default: "auto" (optional) type output generate. Use "auto" (default) automatically detect appropriate type based dependent variables: Numeric/integer variables → "int_plot_html" Factor/character variables → "cat_plot_html" list registered types session, use get_makeme_types(). ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. require_common_categories Check common categories scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether check items share common categories. crowd group(s) display results vector<character> // default: c("target", "others", "") (optional) Choose whether produce results target (mesos) group, others, , combinations . mesos_var Variable data indicating groups tailor reports scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column name data indicating groups mesos reports produced. mesos_group scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) String, target group. simplify_output scalar<logical> // default: TRUE TRUE, list output single output element return element , whereas list multiple elements return list. hide_for_crowd_if_all_na Hide variable output containing NA scalar<boolean> // default: TRUE Whether remove variables (particular useful mesos) values NA hide_for_crowd_if_valid_n_below Hide variable variable < n observations scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains fewer n observations (always ignoring NA). hide_for_crowd_if_category_k_below Hide variable < k categories scalar<integer> // default: 2 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains fewer k used categories (always ignoring NA). Defaults 2 unitary plot/table rarely informative. hide_for_crowd_if_category_n_below Hide variable category < n observations scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains category less n observations (ignoring NA) Cells 0 count considered usually problem anonymity. hide_for_crowd_if_cell_n_below Hide variable cell < n scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd combination dep-indep results cell less n observations (ignoring NA). Cells 0 count considered usually problem anonymity. hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd Conditional hiding scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Select one crowd output groups. selected, hide variable across crowd-outputs reason displayed hide_for_all_if_hidden_for_crowd. instance, say: crowd = c("target", "others"), hide_variable_if_all_na = TRUE, hide_for_all_if_hidden_for_crowd = "target" hide variables target others-outputs NA target-group. hide_indep_cat_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd Conditionally hide independent categories scalar<logical> // default: FALSE hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd specified, categories indep variable(s) hidden crowd exist crowds specified hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd? useful e.g. indep academic disciplines, mesos_var institutions, specific institution interested seeing academic disciplines offer . add_n_to_dep_label, add_n_to_indep_label Add N= variable label scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label dependent /independent variable. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_dep_label_prefix, translations$add_n_to_dep_label_suffix, translations$add_n_to_indep_label_prefix, translations$add_n_to_indep_label_suffix. add_n_to_label Add N= variable label dep indep scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_label_prefix translations$add_n_to_label_suffix. add_n_to_category Add N= category scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end category. likely produce range across variables, hence infix (comma) minimum maximum can specified. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_category_prefix, translations$add_n_to_category_infix, translations$add_n_to_category_suffix. totals Include totals scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include totals output. categories_treated_as_na NA categories vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Categories treated NA. label_separator separate main question sub-question scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Separator main question sub-question. error_on_duplicates Error warn duplicate labels scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether abort (TRUE) warn (FALSE) label (suffix) used across multiple variables. showNA Show NA categories vector<character> // default: c("ifany", "always", "never") (optional) Choose whether show NA categories results. data_label Data label scalar<character> // default: "proportion" (optional) One "proportion", "percentage", "percentage_bare", "count", "mean", "median". data_label_position Data label position scalar<character> // default: "center" (optional) Position data labels bars. One "center" (middle bar), "bottom" (bottom inside bar), "top" (top inside bar), "" (bar outside). html_interactive Toggle interactive plot scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether plot interactive (ggiraph) static (ggplot2). hide_axis_text_if_single_variable Hide y-axis text just single variable scalar<boolean> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether hide text y-axis label just single variable. hide_label_if_prop_below Hide label threshold scalar<numeric> // default: NULL (optional) Whether hide label value. inverse Flag swap x-axis faceting scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) TRUE, swaps x-axis faceting. vertical Display plot vertically scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) TRUE, display plot vertically. digits Decimal places scalar<integer> // default: 0L (optional) Number decimal places. data_label_decimal_symbol Decimal symbol scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Decimal marker, might prefer comma ',' something else entirely. x_axis_label_width, strip_width Label width x-axis strip texts plots scalar<integer> // default: 20 (optional) Width labels used categorical column names x-axis texts strip texts. sort_dep_by sort dependent variables vector<character> // default: ".variable_position" (optional) Sort dependent variables output. using indep-argument, sorting differs ordered factors unordered factors: Ordering ordered factors always respected output (levels define base order). Unordered factors reordered sort_dep_by. NULL ".variable_position" Sort variable position supplied data frame (default). ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".variable_name" Sort variable names. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. sort_indep_by sort independent variable categories vector<character> // default: ".factor_order" (optional) Sort independent variable categories output. ".factor_order", preserves original factor level order independent variable. Passing NULL accepted treated ".factor_order". NULL sorting - preserves original factor level order (default). ".top" proportion highest category available. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available. character() Character vector category labels sum together. sort_by sort output (legacy) vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) DEPRECATED: Use sort_dep_by sort_indep_by instead clearer control. specified, parameter used dependent independent sorting. NULL (default), dependent variables sorted .variable_position. NULL Uses .variable_position dependent variables, sorting independent. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".variable_name" Sort variable names. ".variable_position" Sort variable position supplied data frame. ".by_group" groups argument. character() Character vector category labels sum together. descend Sorting order scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_by figures tables. Works ordered unordered factors - ordered factors, reverses display order preserving inherent level ordering. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. descend_indep Sorting order independent variables scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_indep_by figures tables. Works ordered unordered factors - ordered factors, reverses display order preserving inherent level ordering. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. labels_always_at_top, labels_always_at_bottom Top/bottom variables vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always placed top bottom figures/tables. table_wide Pivot table wider scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether pivot table wider. table_main_question_as_header Table main question header scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include main question header table. n_categories_limit Limit cat_table_ wide format scalar<integer> // default: 12 (optional) number categories categorical variable, cat_table_* long format instead wide format. translations Localize output list<character> list translations name code value translation. See examples. plot_height DOCX-setting scalar<numeric> // default: 12 (optional) DOCX plots need height, currently set easily Quarto chunk option. colour_palette Colour palette vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Must contain least number unique values (including missing) data set. colour_2nd_binary_cat Colour second binary category scalar<character> // default: "#ffffff" (optional) Colour second category binary variables. Often useful hide . colour_na Colour NA category scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Colour single string NA values, showNA "ifany" "always". main_font_size, label_font_size, strip_font_size, legend_font_size Font sizes scalar<integer> // default: 6 (optional) DOCX-OUTPUT. output adjusted using e.g. ggplot2::theme() set global theme (ggplot2::set_theme()). Font sizes general text (6), data label text (3), strip text (6) legend text (6). font_family Font family scalar<character> // default: "sans" (optional) Word font family. See officer::fp_text. path Output path DOCX scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path save docx-output. docx_template Filename rdocx object scalar<character>|<rdocx>-object // default: NULL (optional) Can either valid character path reference Word file, existing rdocx-object memory.

what: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
title: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
text: Offers systematic way conditional reporting figures tables many (bivariate combinations ) variables, typically survey data. Contains interactive 'ggiraph'-based (https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ggiraph) plotting functions data frame-based summary tables (bivariate significance tests, frequencies/proportions, unique open ended responses, etc) many arguments customization, extensions possible. Uses global options() system neatly reducing redundant code. Also contains tools immediate saving objects returning hashed link object, useful creating download links high resolution images upon rendering 'Quarto'. Suitable highly customized reports, primarily intended survey research.

title: Summarize a survey dataset for use in tables and graphs — summarize_cat_cat_data
text: data data.frame/tibble srvyr-object (experimental) data.frame // required data used plotting. dep, indep Variable selections <tidyselect> // Default: NULL, meaning everything dep, nothing indep. Columns data. dep compulsory. ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. showNA Show NA categories vector<character> // default: c("ifany", "always", "never") (optional) Choose whether show NA categories results. totals Include totals scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include totals output. sort_by sort output (legacy) vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) DEPRECATED: Use sort_dep_by sort_indep_by instead clearer control. specified, parameter used dependent independent sorting. NULL (default), dependent variables sorted .variable_position. NULL Uses .variable_position dependent variables, sorting independent. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".variable_name" Sort variable names. ".variable_position" Sort variable position supplied data frame. ".by_group" groups argument. character() Character vector category labels sum together. sort_dep_by sort dependent variables vector<character> // default: ".variable_position" (optional) Sort dependent variables output. using indep-argument, sorting differs ordered factors unordered factors: Ordering ordered factors always respected output (levels define base order). Unordered factors reordered sort_dep_by. NULL ".variable_position" Sort variable position supplied data frame (default). ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".variable_name" Sort variable names. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. sort_indep_by sort independent variable categories vector<character> // default: ".factor_order" (optional) Sort independent variable categories output. ".factor_order", preserves original factor level order independent variable. Passing NULL accepted treated ".factor_order". NULL sorting - preserves original factor level order (default). ".top" proportion highest category available. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available. character() Character vector category labels sum together. data_label Data label scalar<character> // default: "proportion" (optional) One "proportion", "percentage", "percentage_bare", "count", "mean", "median". digits Decimal places scalar<integer> // default: 0L (optional) Number decimal places. add_n_to_dep_label, add_n_to_indep_label Add N= variable label scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label dependent /independent variable. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_dep_label_prefix, translations$add_n_to_dep_label_suffix, translations$add_n_to_indep_label_prefix, translations$add_n_to_indep_label_suffix. add_n_to_label Add N= variable label dep indep scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_label_prefix translations$add_n_to_label_suffix. add_n_to_category Add N= category scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end category. likely produce range across variables, hence infix (comma) minimum maximum can specified. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_category_prefix, translations$add_n_to_category_infix, translations$add_n_to_category_suffix. hide_label_if_prop_below Hide label threshold scalar<numeric> // default: NULL (optional) Whether hide label value. data_label_decimal_symbol Decimal symbol scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Decimal marker, might prefer comma ',' something else entirely. categories_treated_as_na NA categories vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Categories treated NA. label_separator separate main question sub-question scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Separator main question sub-question. descend Sorting order scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_by figures tables. Works ordered unordered factors - ordered factors, reverses display order preserving inherent level ordering. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. descend_indep Sorting order independent variables scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_indep_by figures tables. Works ordered unordered factors - ordered factors, reverses display order preserving inherent level ordering. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. labels_always_at_top, labels_always_at_bottom Top/bottom variables vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always placed top bottom figures/tables. translations Localize output list<character> list translations name code value translation. See examples. call Internal call obj:<call> // Default: rlang::caller_env() (optional) absolute relative folderpaths required, strings.

what: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
title: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
text: Generates text summaries comparing two groups categorical mesos plot data. function identifies meaningful differences groups based proportions respondents selecting specific categories produces narrative text descriptions.

title: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
code: txt_from_cat_mesos_plots(   plots,   min_prop_diff = 0.1,   n_highest_categories = 1,   flip_to_lowest_categories = FALSE,   digits = 2,   selected_categories_last_split = " or ",   fallback_string = character(),   reverse = FALSE,   glue_str_pos =     c(paste0("For {var}, the target group has a higher proportion of respondents ",     "({group_1}) than all others ({group_2}) who answered {selected_categories}."),     paste0("More respondents answered {selected_categories} for {var} in the ",     "target group ({group_1}) than in other groups ({group_2})."),     paste0("The statement {var} shows {selected_categories} responses are more ",     "common in the target group ({group_1}) compared to others ({group_2}).")),   glue_str_neg =     c(paste0("For {var}, the target group has a lower proportion of respondents ",     "({group_1}) than all others ({group_2}) who answered {selected_categories}."),     paste0("Fewer respondents answered {selected_categories} for {var} in the ",     "target group ({group_1}) than in other groups ({group_2})."),     paste0("The statement {var} shows {selected_categories} responses are less ",     "common in the target group ({group_1}) compared to others ({group_2}).")) )

title: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
text: plots list two plot objects (data frames plot data) compare. must contain columns: .variable_label, .category, .category_order, .proportion. min_prop_diff Numeric. Minimum proportion difference (default 0.10) required groups generate text. Differences threshold ignored. n_highest_categories Integer. Number top categories include comparison (default 1). Categories selected based .category_order. applied variable categories value. flip_to_lowest_categories Logical. TRUE, compare lowest categories instead highest (default FALSE). digits Integer. Number decimal places rounding proportions (default 2). selected_categories_last_split Character. Separator last item listing multiple categories (default " "). fallback_string Character. String return validation fails (default character()). reverse Logical. TRUE, reverses order output text summaries (default FALSE). glue_str_pos Character vector. Templates positive differences (group_1 > group_2). Available placeholders: {var}, {group_1}, {group_2}, {selected_categories}. glue_str_neg Character vector. Templates negative differences (group_2 > group_1). placeholders glue_str_pos.

title: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
text: character vector text summaries, one per variable meaningful differences. Returns empty character vector plots provided meaningful differences found.

title: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
text: function compares proportions two groups variable plot data. One template randomly selected provided vectors variety output text.

title: Extract Text Summary from Categorical Mesos Plots — txt_from_cat_mesos_plots
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create sample plot data plot_data_1 <- data.frame(   .variable_label = rep("Job satisfaction", 3),   .category = factor(c("Low", "Medium", "High"), levels = c("Low", "Medium", "High")),   .category_order = 1:3,   .proportion = c(0.2, 0.3, 0.5) )  plot_data_2 <- data.frame(   .variable_label = rep("Job satisfaction", 3),   .category = factor(c("Low", "Medium", "High"), levels = c("Low", "Medium", "High")),   .category_order = 1:3,   .proportion = c(0.3, 0.4, 0.3) )  plots <- list(   list(data = plot_data_1),   list(data = plot_data_2) )  # Generate text summaries txt_from_cat_mesos_plots(plots, min_prop_diff = 0.10)  # Compare lowest categories instead txt_from_cat_mesos_plots(   plots,   flip_to_lowest_categories = TRUE,   min_prop_diff = 0.05 ) } # }

title: saros 1.6.1.9000 (dev)
text: Enhanced ggsaver() automatically apply colour palettes girafe() global settings saving plots. ensures saved PNG/PDF images match appearance interactive plots displayed girafe(). Palette settings can configured via global_settings_set(fn_name = "girafe", new = list(palette_codes = ...)) automatically applied saving plots get_fig_title_suffix_from_ggplot() direct ggsaver() calls

title: saros 1.6.1.9000 (dev)
text: Fixed fig_height_h_barchart2() properly handle int_plot_html plots independent variables. function now forwards fig_height_h_barchart() appropriate parameters interval plots, returning max parameter value (default 12) allowing user customization, instead erroring “supports single indep variable” Fixed n_range2() int_plot_html plots report N range per dependent variable instead total count across variables. Now correctly calculates sample size separately variable reports range (e.g., [250-299] variables different amounts missing data)

title: saros 1.6.1.9000 (dev)
text: validation functions now use consistent validate_* prefix better discoverability via auto-complete (e.g., validate_bool(), validate_integerish(), validate_double(), validate_string()) Added validate_params() helper function consolidates multiple parameter validations single declarative call, reducing code duplication 30+ lines ~5 lines fig_height_h_barchart() Created validation rule builders (validate_integerish_rule(), validate_double_rule(), validate_bool_rule(), validate_string_rule()) expressive maintainable validation specifications validate_makeme_options() Maintained backwards compatibility check_* aliases existing code Improved code maintainability readability across validation-heavy functions Added is_int_plot_html() helper function centralize detection logic int_plot_html data structures, improving code maintainability consistency across fig_height_h_barchart2() n_rng2()

title: saros 1.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2026-01-28

title: saros 1.6.1
text: Added quiet parameter global_settings_reset() optionally suppress informational messages resetting global settings package defaults Numeric variables -> int_plot_html Single character variable -> chr_table_html Factor/ordered multiple character variables -> cat_plot_html Unsupported types (Date, POSIXct, POSIXt, list, complex) produce clear error messages identifying problematic variables eliminates uninformative “arguments must length” error accidentally providing numeric variables without specifying type. Mixed variable types produce clear error message suggesting correct type use

title: saros 1.6.1
text: Fixed issue #518 crowd_plots_as_tabset() save = NULL produced cryptic “object ‘caption’ found” error. Added proper validation ensure save parameter single logical value (TRUE FALSE) Fixed txt_from_cat_mesos_plots() second group (others) proportions incorrectly became zero. Refactored process variable separately, ensuring groups’ proportions correctly calculated per variable Fixed txt_from_cat_mesos_plots() n_highest_categories=2 binary (2-category) variables summed categories 1.0, producing uninformative results. Now applies n_highest_categories variable categories threshold, otherwise uses single highest/lowest category Fixed issue #511 x_axis_label_width parameter effect int_plot_html independent variable present. apply_label_wrapping() function now correctly wraps .variable_label indep_length == 0 Fixed issue #512 makeme() multiple crowds produced identical plots instead crowd-specific filtered data. process_crowd_data() function now correctly passes filtered subset_data make_content() crowd, ensuring plot displays statistics computed crowd’s data subset Fixed txt_from_cat_mesos_plots() handle cases .category_order contains NA values using na.rm = TRUE calculating max values, preventing “NA/NaN argument” errors Fixed n_rng2() correctly calculate sample sizes int_plot_html plots checking complete cases relevant variables (.value independent variables) instead columns dataset. Also modified make_content.int_plot_html() include necessary columns plot object, reducing memory footprint

title: saros 1.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-11-10

title: saros 1.6.0
text: makeme() returns empty data.frame instead NULL plot table can created, simplifying downstream code (e.g. gt::gt() fails served NULL) Resolved issue #372 - descend parameter now works correctly ordered factors preserving inherent level ordering. Ordered factors maintain natural order base, descend can reverse display order Enhanced custom_palette() allow priority_palette_codes supplement base palette insufficient colors available Improved color palette handling explicit NA factor levels using showNA = "always"

title: saros 1.6.0
text: New output type: makeme(type = "int_plot_html") interactive interval plots violin box plots New function: txt_from_cat_mesos_plots() generate textual summaries two categorical mesos-scale plots, highlighting significant differences selected categories groups. Supports global settings via global_settings_set() (closes #506) New function: crowd_plots_as_tabset() convert list ggplot2 objects (typically makeme(crowd = ...)) Quarto tabsets automatic height calculation optional download links. Supports categorical interval plots intelligent auto-detection based plot layers New exported function: get_fig_title_suffix_from_ggplot() generates figure title suffixes N range optional download links plots

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Added support data_label = "mean" data_label = "median" makeme() type = "cat_*_html" outputs (addresses issue #460) Added data_label_position argument makeme() allowing data labels positioned “center”, “bottom”, “top”, “” bars categorical plots (addresses issue #365) Enhanced chr_table_html support multiple independent variables displaying background context open-ended text responses Added na_colour parameter hex_bw() function allow customization text color NA fills (default: “#ffffff”) Added colour_2nd_binary_cat parameter girafe() checkbox plots - set checked/not_checked, reverses category order second category receives specified color

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Independent-variable ordering now computed per dependent variable, allowing indep order vary per dep; descend_indep now consistently reverses indep order across tables plots; plots use centralized .indep_order indep x-axis; ordered indep factors take precedence sort_indep_by (reversed descend_indep=TRUE); legends preserve unused response levels .category Implemented B1 strategy direct column-based sorting via whitelists. Allowed keys dependent variables now centrally defined enforced; independent variables use similar whitelist (including .count_total_indep). prevents accidental sorting arbitrary missing columns clarifies supported behavior sort_indep_by now explicitly defaults ".factor_order" accepts NULL (treated ".factor_order"). independent variable provided (indep = NULL), specifying sort_indep_by descend_indep longer errors; simply ignored Improved sorting stability dependent variables missing/duplicate labels — internal joins computing .dep_order now key .variable_name (unique) instead .variable_label, preventing many--one join errors edge cases preserving displayed labels

title: saros 1.6.0
text: CRITICAL: Resolved bug makeme() combinations valid factor variables -NA factor variables incorrectly threw “mix categorical continuous variables” error. Variable type checking now uses filtered variable lists instead original lists, preventing premature type validation errors Resolved issue #464 - makeme() failures sigtest_table dep indep variables overlap. Now automatically excludes indep variables dep selection prevent conflicts

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Added vector length validation get_fig_title_suffix_from_ggplot() prevent subscript---bounds errors vectorized parameters mismatched lengths n_rng2() now gracefully handles plots created makeme() calculating N complete cases instead aborting, properly handles -NA empty .count_per_indep_group values returning “0” clear warnings instead producing infinite values crowd_plots_as_tabset() now validates plot individually loop, preventing invalid objects causing failures Improved empty data frame handling throughout - using .data.frame() nrow() checks instead length() reliable validation

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Resolved faceting issue int_plot_html label_separator = NULL independent variables caused violin/boxplot label geoms appear separate facets due inconsistent string wrapping Removed unnecessary “multiple main questions” warning using label_separator = NULL, different main questions expected behavior Corrected double NA check logic check_bool() function - removed redundant condition made validation always pass NA values Improved NULL NA handling glue_together_range() prevent edge case failures empty invalid data ranges Improved robustness check_no_duplicated_label_suffix() handle empty data frames missing columns gracefully Enhanced check_sort_by() validation properly handle empty character vectors clear error messages Improved keep_subitem() handle character inputs use factor levels better NA handling Simplified arrange_table_data() sorting logic better reliability Updated documentation reference ggplot2::theme_set() ggplot2::set_theme() due ggplot2 4.0.0 Fixed custom_palette() girafe() properly handle unnamed elements priority_palette_codes colors “NA” category. Previously, unnamed elements filtered , causing NA categories receive color assignment (appearing white fill white text)

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Optimized makeme() examples 73.8% faster execution (6.6s → 1.7s total). Reduced variable counts crowd configurations maintaining educational value Updated fig_height_h_barchart2() example consistency optimized examples Completely rewrote .spread algorithm subset_vector() better spread maximization using evenly spaced positions

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Substantially modularized internal implementation makeme() focused helper functions (argument setup, crowd processing, output assembly, validation). Improves readability, testability, robustness without changing public API (closes #368) Split post_process_makeme_data() focused single-responsibility functions: process_indep_factor_levels() general factor reversal process_binary_category_colors() cat_plot_html-specific binary category processing Moved process_binary_category_colors() logic make_content.cat_plot_html() girafe(), consolidating color-related logic one place Refactored checkbox plot handling girafe() integrate colour_2nd_binary_cat parameter convert_to_checkbox_plot() function Modularized tabular /O functionality - renamed pretty_tabular.R tabular_write.R extracted tabular_read() function separate file Centralized global constants (sorting whitelists) zzz.R .saros.env easier maintenance Extracted duplicate label wrapping logic apply_label_wrapping() helper function, improving maintainability consistency Added explicit return statement make_content.int_plot_html() clarity Added .onUnload() function clean global options package unloaded, preventing option pollution user’s R session Using air consistent code formatting CRAN Compliance: Reduced string lengths documentation girafe() makeme() functions meet CRAN’s character limit per line requirement

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Added comprehensive test coverage makeme() helper functions full roxygen2 documentation @keywords internal annotation internal API clarity Added comprehensive visual regression testing int_plot_html using vdiffr snapshot tests covering various scenarios Added comprehensive test coverage utility validation functions edge cases including -NA variables Added test coverage global settings support txt_from_cat_mesos_plots() proper cleanup using withr::defer() Added VS Code configuration improved development experience Added survey package Suggests enhanced testing capabilities Updated build ignore patterns coverage reports library files
